Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of MRI and Intraoperative Electrophysiological Recording in Targeting the Subthalamic Nucleus for Parkinson's Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 27 Parkinson's disease patients from a single surgical center

Participants.evidence: 27 Parkinson's disease patients from a single surgical center, meeting eligibility criteria for STN targeting

Intervention.evidence: Target planning utilised MRI visualisation and coordinate guidelines relative to the AC–PC line. Intraoperative microelectrode recording refined electrode positions

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the efficacy of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and intraoperative electrophysiological recording in enhancing electrode placement accuracy

Number_Randomised.evidence: 27 Parkinson's disease patients from a single surgical center

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean placement error was 0.48 mm, 0.69 mm, and 2.9 mm in the x, y, and z axes, respectively

Harms.evidence: No postoperative MRI-related complications were reported
